chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Wiedmeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs shall be paid as a condition of probation in Washington County case no: 14CF367.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State. On a plea to Ct 1 State moves to dismiss Ct. 2 for read in. Partial joint recommendation, Def free to argue jail time; Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, on motion of the State Court dismisses Ct 2 for read in. Argument from State, Counsel; Statements from Def; Court proceeds to sentencing.
Hearing on January 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
HE set 1-14-15 at 2:45pm rescheduled to 1-23-15 at 1:30pm per Atty Borkowicz - resolution expected, but not a joint agreement.  DA notified via email, counsel to notify def and notice sent.
Hearing on January 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Per request of counsel and State, HE set 1-7-15 at 8:15am in Br 1 rescheduled to resolve in Br 4 w/14CF367 on 1-14-15 at 2:45pm
Hearing on January 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Not guilty plea entered.  Counsel advises the Br. 4 case is set for a court trial on 1-5-15 and anticipate this case will resolve in Br. 4 after the trial.  Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on November 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ. (14CF144 and 14CF367 Br. 4) State opposes the Defense Bail Modification Motion, counsel advises defendant is going to be going through a lot of medical testing and having to be transported to Froedtert.  Court denies the Bail Motion and cash bail remains.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail
Letter received from Atty Borkowicz
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Arraignment on October 15, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ. (14CF144 & 14CF367 Br. 4)   Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Not operate motor vehicle; Maintain absolute sobriety
Preliminary hearing on September 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich for Atty. Borkowicz State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (14CF144 and 14CF367 Br. 4)   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant currently disabled.  Atty. Borkowicz will be appointed by SPD.  State rqst. $2,500.00 cash bond, counsel advises defendant has a terminal illness and do not believe additional cash bond is necessary and rqst. a signature bond.  Court orders $7,500.00 cash bond.  Defendant wants to enter plea, Court does not accept a plea at this time.   PRELIM TIMING NOT WAIVED.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
